entry.title: [PHOTOS] Weekly Kansai #7
entry.content:
It's getting cold here in Japan. The color of the leaves are starting to change. Last week's highlights are walking around China Town in Motomachi-Kobe and Halloween party at Amemura-Shinsaibashi.


// Photos are sorted from oldest to recent.

// Unlikely, but just in case you have a crazy idea to use my photos, contact me first, ok?

entry.title: [PHOTOS] Weekly Kansai #6
entry.content:
It's a gloomy Tuesday here in Japan thanks to the morning rain. This week's highlights will be Expendables 2, walking around Namba, losing my wallet, watching a boring performance of Pirates of Dotomburi, and finding my wallet again.

entry.title: [PHOTOS] Weekly Kansai #5
entry.content:
Last week, thanks to the monday holiday, we spent time in Awaji area and visited Naruto whirlpool. Unfortunately we were not greeted by the strong and big whirlpool. Only the small ones.

On the weekend, we went to Mount Rokko. No, we didn't climb, nor hike. Just took the cable car, bus, and ropeway. ( ^_ ^ ;). Stumbled upon restless swarm of hungry fishes and the magnificent ÊûùÂûÇ„Çå (Howling dome) art.



// Photos are sorted from oldest to recent.

// Unlikely, but just in case you have a crazy idea to use my photos, contact me first, ok?

entry.title: [PHOTOS] Weekly Kansai #4
entry.content:
It's the 4th Weekly Kansai series. It means it's been a month since I started this weekly photos. So far most photos are from my Instagram. How do you like it so far?

This week's highlights are AirStash, met Ken Lee for the first time, India Mela 2012 Festival, and a short trip to Awaji for wifey's birthday.

entry.title: [PHOTOS] Weekly Kansai #3
entry.content:
Can't believe it's October already. Time flies too fast, don't you think? Anyway, highlights of the week: Typhoon No. 17, Canon EOS M, JLPT N2 Registration, and lots of jogging.
